channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Two deep potholes,, 19th February
item.description:
It seems that they were fixed before but really badly! They are deep affecting cars’ suspension!

item.title: Wilderton Road N16 needs cleaning, 19th February
item.description:
Stale bread on pavement to attract Foxes and rats, also litter around trees bases. Needs cleaning.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilderton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 sofas, in mattress, 1 carpet flytipoed, 19th February
item.description:
The sofa has been there for at least a month, now there is a new sofa a carpet some other plastic goods and a massive bag of used nappies that is smeared on the floor close to the sofas

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, East Dulwich Road, East Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Signage not graffitied but taped - tape to be removed, 19th February

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elgar Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: Large pothole on bus and cycle route, 19th February
item.description:
This is a reappearing pothole. The top layer of tarmac has come apart and now there is a large drop that will affect bus traffic, fast circulating bikes (it's a popular downhill route) and foot traffic to and from the hospital. The pothole is on the clinic's side of the pedestrian crossing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 106, Denmark Hill, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped dirty double mattress, 19th February
item.description:
Looked out window and saw this at 8am . Not seen before.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fossington Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of dog waste outside 11 Bromar Road, 19th February
item.description:
Please can you clear this AND please can you install warning signs on Bromar Road as this is a repeat issue since I moved here in March 2025. I previously requested signage to be installed but this was not done. If the problem continues I will have to keep submitting reports until there are signs installed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Bromar Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole is completely covered by rubbish, mud and other stuff, 19th February
item.description:
Can we finally after months clean the manholes in Blackheath Road? Two manholes in front of Wickes and 71 Blackheath Road are fully covered; therefore completely useless. Luckily, it is not raining every day in London since January 2026. Ah no, it does.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Blackheath Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, overfull bins, broken black rubbish bags, 19th February
item.description:
I have already reported several times the antisocial behaviour of 3 Grummant Road residents. We often experience fly tipping rubbish on the pavement that is becoming an health and safety issue for residents as it attracts pest and foxes. the council should address this ASB as a matter of urgency

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Grummant Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
